title: Theorems according to Mertzios and Unger

blocks.name: 2pthfrgrrn
blocks.content: Between any two (different) vertices in a friendship graph is a 2-path (path of length 2), see Proposition 1(b) of [MertziosUnger] p. 153 : "A friendship graph G ..., as well as the distance between any two nodes in G is at most two". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 1-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:

  ralimdvva(s0, s1, c1, cdif(c1, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(c0, cusgr), wreu(s2, c1, wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s0)), cpr(cv(s2), cv(s1))), c2)), wrex(s2, c1, wa(wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s2)), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s1)), c2))))

  sylbbr(wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s0)), cpr(cv(s2), cv(s1))), c2), wa(wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s2)), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s1)), c2)), wa(wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s0)), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s1)), c2)))
  anbi1i(wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s2)), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s1)), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s0)), c2))

}

thm 2pthfrgrrn2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ FriendGraph → ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈(c1 \ { s0 }), ∃(s2 ∈ c1,(({ s0, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s1 } ∈ c2)∧(s0 ≠ s2 ∧ s2 ≠ s1))))))
  ⊣ c1 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(Edg ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
} = {
  mpd(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈(c1 \ { s0 }), ∃(s2 ∈ c1,(({ s0, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s1 } ∈ c2)∧(s0 ≠ s2 ∧ s2 ≠ s1))))), ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈(c1 \ { s0 }), ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s1 } ∈ c2)))))
  2pthfrgrrn(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, c2)
  ralimdvva(s0, s1, c1, (c1 \ { s0 }), c0 ∈ FriendGraph, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s1 } ∈ c2)), ∃(s2 ∈ c1,(({ s0, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s1 } ∈ c2)∧(s0 ≠ s2 ∧ s2 ≠ s1))))
  reximdva(s2, c1, (c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧(s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s1 ∈(c1 \ { s0 }))), ({ s0, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s1 } ∈ c2), (({ s0, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s1 } ∈ c2)∧(s0 ≠ s2 ∧ s2 ≠ s1)))
  ancld(((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧(s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s1 ∈(c1 \ { s0 })))∧ s2 ∈ c1), ({ s0, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s1 } ∈ c2), (s0 ≠ s2 ∧ s2 ≠ s1))
  ad2antrr(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, (s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s1 ∈(c1 \ { s0 })), s2 ∈ c1, (({ s0, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s1 } ∈ c2)→(s0 ≠ s2 ∧ s2 ≠ s1)))
  syl(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, (({ s0, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s1 } ∈ c2)→(s0 ≠ s2 ∧ s2 ≠ s1)), c0 ∈ USGraph)
  frgrusgr(c0)
  anim12d(c0 ∈ USGraph, { s0, s2 } ∈ c2, { s2, s1 } ∈ c2, s0 ≠ s2, s2 ≠ s1)
  ex(c0 ∈ USGraph, { s0, s2 } ∈ c2, s0 ≠ s2)
  usgredgne(c0, s0, s2, c2)
  ex(c0 ∈ USGraph, { s2, s1 } ∈ c2, s2 ≠ s1)
  usgredgne(c0, s2, s1, c2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cfrgr)
  diff.cfrgr.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, cfrgr)
  diff.cfrgr.s(s1)
  diff.wa.s(s2, c0 ∈ FriendGraph, (s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s1 ∈(c1 \ { s0 })))
  diff.wcel.s(s2, c0, cfrgr)
  diff.cfrgr.s(s2)
  diff.wa.s(s2, s0 ∈ c1, s1 ∈(c1 \ { s0 }))
  diff.wcel.s(s2, s0, c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s2, s1, (c1 \ { s0 }))
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cdif.s(s2, c1, { s0 })
  diff.csn.s(s2, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)

}

blocks.name: 3cyclfrgrrn1
blocks.content: Every vertex in a friendship graph (with more than 1 vertex) is part of a 3-cycle. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 16-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 2-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: 3cyclfrgrrn
blocks.content: Every vertex in a friendship graph (with more than 1 vertex) is part of a 3-cycle. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 16-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 2-Apr-2021.)

  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c1))), wral(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, wrex(s2, c1, w3a(wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s1), cv(s2)), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s0)), c2)))))), diffsc(s0, c2))

thm 3cyclfrgrrn(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ 1[<](# ` c1))→ ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2)))))
  ⊣ c1 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(Edg ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ 1[<](# ` c1))→ ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2))))), d(s0, c2))
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ 1[<](# ` c1))→ ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2))))), d(s1, c0))
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ 1[<](# ` c1))→ ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2))))), d(s2, c0))
  ralrimiv(s0, c1, (c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ 1[<](# ` c1)), ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2))))
  imp(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, 1[<](# ` c1), (s0 ∈ c1 → ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2)))))
  com13(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, 1[<](# ` c1), s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2))))
  pm2.43a(s0 ∈ c1, 1[<](# ` c1), (c0 ∈ FriendGraph → ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2)))))
  expcom(s0 ∈ c1, 1[<](# ` c1), (s0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ∈ FriendGraph → ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2))))))
  syl((1[<](# ` c1)∧ s0 ∈ c1), (s0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ∈ FriendGraph → ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2))))), ∃(hs0 ∈ c1, s0 ≠ hs0))
  mp3an1(1[<](# ` c1), s0 ∈ c1, ∃(hs0 ∈ c1, s0 ≠ hs0), c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  fvexi(c1, cvtx, c0)
  hashgt12el2(hs0, c1, universe, s0)
  rexlimiv(hs0, c1, s0 ≠ hs0, (s0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ∈ FriendGraph → ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2))))))
  3exp1(hs0 ∈ c1, s0 ≠ hs0, s0 ∈ c1, c0 ∈ FriendGraph, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2))))
  syl3anc(((hs0 ∈ c1 ∧ s0 ≠ hs0 ∧ s0 ∈ c1)∧ c0 ∈ FriendGraph), ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, s2 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s2, s0 } ∈ c2))), c0 ∈ FriendGraph, (s0 ∈ c1 ∧ hs0 ∈ c1), s0 ≠ hs0)

blocks.name: 3cyclfrgr
blocks.content: Every vertex in a friendship graph (with more than 1 vertex) is part of a 3-cycle. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 2-Apr-2021.)

  diff.hs0.w(wex(s1, wex(s2, w3a(wbr(cv(s1), cfv(ccycls, c0), cv(s2)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s1)), nat3), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), nat0), cv(s0))))))

blocks.name: 4cycl2v2nb
blocks.content: In a (maybe degenerate) 4-cycle, two vertice have two (maybe not different) common neighbors. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 2-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm 4cycl2v2nb(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wa(wcel(cpr(c0, c1), c2), wcel(cpr(c1, c3), c2)), wa(wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c2), wcel(cpr(c4, c0), c2))), wa(wss(cpr(cpr(c0, c1), cpr(c1, c3)), c2), wss(cpr(cpr(c0, c4), cpr(c4, c3)), c2)))
} = {
  anim12i(wa(wcel(cpr(c0, c1), c2), wcel(cpr(c1, c3), c2)), wa(wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c2), wcel(cpr(c4, c0), c2)), wss(cpr(cpr(c0, c1), cpr(c1, c3)), c2), wss(cpr(cpr(c0, c4), cpr(c4, c3)), c2))

  syl2anr(wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c2), wcel(cpr(c4, c0), c2), wss(cpr(cpr(c0, c4), cpr(c4, c3)), c2), wcel(cpr(c0, c4), c2), wcel(cpr(c4, c3), c2))
  biimpi(wcel(cpr(c4, c0), c2), wcel(cpr(c0, c4), c2))
  eleq1i(cpr(c4, c0), c2, cpr(c0, c4))
  prcom(c4, c0)
  biimpi(wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c2), wcel(cpr(c4, c3), c2))
  eleq1i(cpr(c3, c4), c2, cpr(c4, c3))
  prcom(c3, c4)

}

blocks.name: n4cyclfrgr
blocks.content: There is no 4-cycle in a friendship graph, see Proposition 1(a) of [MertziosUnger] p. 153 : "A friendship graph G contains no C4 as a subgraph ...". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 2-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm n4cyclfrgr(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ccycls, c0), c2)), wne(cfv(chash, c1), nat4))
} = {
  pm2.61d1(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wbr(c1, cfv(ccycls, c0), c2)), wne(cfv(chash, c1), nat4), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat4))

blocks.content: A graph with a 4-cycle is not a friendhip graph. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 2-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: frgrnbnb
blocks.content: If two neighbors ` U ` and ` W ` of a vertex ` X ` have a common neighbor ` A ` in a friendship graph, then this common neighbor ` A ` must be the vertex ` X ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 2-Apr-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 13-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: vdgn0frgrv2
blocks.content: A vertex in a friendship graph with more than one vertex cannot have degree 0. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 9-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 4-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: vdgn1frgrv2
blocks.content: Any vertex in a friendship graph does not have degree 1, see remark 2 in [MertziosUnger] p. 153 (after Proposition 1): "... no node v of it [a friendship graph] may have deg(v) = 1.". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 4-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: vdgn1frgrv3
blocks.content: Any vertex in a friendship graph does not have degree 1, see remark 2 in [MertziosUnger] p. 153 (after Proposition 1): "... no node v of it [a friendship graph] may have deg(v) = 1.". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 4-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 4-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm vdgn1frgrv3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c1))), wral(s0, c1, wne(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)), nat1)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  ralrimiv(s0, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c1))), wne(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)), nat1))
  impancom(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wne(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)), nat1))
  vdgn1frgrv2(c0, cv(s0), c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(c0, cfrgr), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c1)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cfrgr)
  diff.cfrgr.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c1))
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.clt.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, chash, c1)
  diff.chash.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm vdgn1frgrv3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ 1[<](# ` c1))→ ∀(s0 ∈ c1,((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)≠ 1))
  ⊣ c1 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  ralrimiv(s0, c1, (c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ 1[<](# ` c1)), ((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)≠ 1)
  impancom(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, 1[<](# ` c1), s0 ∈ c1, ((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)≠ 1)
  vdgn1frgrv2(c0, s0, c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, c0 ∈ FriendGraph, 1[<](# ` c1))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cfrgr)
  diff.cfrgr.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, nat1, clt, (# ` c1))
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.clt.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, chash, c1)
  diff.chash.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: vdgfrgrgt2
blocks.content: Any vertex in a friendship graph (with more than one vertex - then, actually, the graph must have at least three vertices, because otherwise, it would not be a friendship graph) has at least degree 2, see remark 3 in [MertziosUnger] p. 153 (after Proposition 1): "It follows that deg(v) >= 2 for every node v of a friendship graph". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 21-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 5-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm vdgfrgrgt2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wi(wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c2)), wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
} = {
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c2)), wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1)))
  mpbi2and(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c2))), wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1)), wne(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0), wne(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat1))
  imp(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c2)), wne(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0))
  vdgn0frgrv2(c0, c1, c2)
  imp(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c2)), wne(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat1))
  vdgn1frgrv2(c0, c1, c2)
  ad2antlr(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, c2), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c2)), wb(wa(wne(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0), wne(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat1)), wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1))))
  syl(wcel(c1, c2), wb(wa(wne(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0), wne(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat1)), wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1))), wcel(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), cxnn0))
  vtxdgelxnn0(c1, c2, c0)
  xnn0n0n1ge2b(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm vdgfrgrgt2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(1[<](# ` c2)→ 2[≤]((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)))
  ⊣ c2 =(Vtx ` c0)
} = {
  ex((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ c2), 1[<](# ` c2), 2[≤]((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1))
  mpbi2and(((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ c2)∧ 1[<](# ` c2)), 2[≤]((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1), ((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)≠ 0, ((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)≠ 1)
  imp((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ c2), 1[<](# ` c2), ((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)≠ 0)
  vdgn0frgrv2(c0, c1, c2)
  imp((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ c2), 1[<](# ` c2), ((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)≠ 1)
  vdgn1frgrv2(c0, c1, c2)
  ad2antlr(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, c1 ∈ c2, 1[<](# ` c2), ((((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)≠ 0 ∧((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)≠ 1)↔ 2[≤]((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)))
  syl(c1 ∈ c2, ((((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)≠ 0 ∧((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)≠ 1)↔ 2[≤]((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)), ((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)∈ ℕ0*)
  vtxdgelxnn0(c1, c2, c0)
  xnn0n0n1ge2b(((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1))
}
